text:
A NullPointerException is thrown if one tries to login. The reason is a stale
request object used in the usecase framework.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
Created attachment 17161
Patches src/webapp/lenya/usecases/usecases.js

Use current request object instead of stale one.

Hi Edith
As the patch was kind of rejected, I wonder if there was something wrong with
it. Especially, if it is necessary to get the request object in cocoon flow with
the FlowHelper class or if it's also viable to access it directly with
cocoon.request. Because if it's not viable, there are some more places to fix
this. Thanks for sharing your thoughts and thanks for fixing it anyway.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
edith@apache.org
text:
Sorry Felix, i saw your bug/patch after i solved the problem. I didn't want to
reject your patch, but i had a solution and tested it already, ... Laziness!
Anyway,to get the context, there is no problem to access the request directly
with cocoon.request but if you want to get the URI, ..., you will have some,
because cocoon.request is a scriptable not the request object. To avoid other
"tricky" problems, i prefered to get the request from the FlowHelper class
